front.title: An X-IDNA Profile for DNS Zone Master Files

abstract.t: While the Domain Name System (DNS) has allowed any octets in labelsand ressource records since its inception, traditionally, addressesused for hostnames, email addresses, and other names actuall used inthe DNS were limited to ASCII characters.This memo defines an extension to allow the use of a wide range ofinternationalised addresses that need to be converted to ACE form onthe wire, including domain names and email addresses in zone masterfiles, without removing the ability to include arbitrary octets.
